pr_title: DEV-1478 Run from persisted data given a starting point

timeline.message:
DEV-1478 Run from persisted alignment data (WIP)

First step in re-running from any stage is to re-run from alignment. This was kind of supported
in the past with "AlignmentOutputStorage" but this approach prescribed a fix location in the
runtime bucket for the bams and could not support crams.

The new way hopefully is a nice template for the rest, which introduces a new interface for the
aligner, with a new persistent implementation. The new PersistedAlignment will look for the
existing alignment in the output bucket and use these files in place as the input for subsequent
stages.

This involved various refactoring to support. First, superficially needed to change the name of the
"VmAligner" to BwaAligner to more accurately describe its specificity.

The SomaticPipeline is changed to take an AlignmentPair as input, rather than looking it up via the
storage. This allows us to pass either the "live" alignment or a stored one without any awareness
in the pipeline.

Cram is also supported, but still need to test. Not sure if all tools can work directly with a cram
without additional arguments.

timeline.bodyText: Feels to me like run is a bit overloaded already. Could we use another verb? Like begin or start or restart?
timeline.author: nedleitch

timeline.bodyText: Could we have found a case where a TODO annotation would actually be worthwhile?
timeline.author: nedleitch

timeline.message:
DEV-1478 Run from various starting points

Adds the ability to specify a starting point to the pipeline. The starting point can be
either alignment, calling or purple complete. Each starting point builds off the last,
so purple complete is the union of all 3.

For each stage which can use persistent data, there is a PersistedXxx implementation.
These classes contain the knowledge of the location of the output files for outputs
created with this same version of the pipeline.

It works by using the exists "skipping" mechanism, but enriching the skipped output
with the actual location in google storage.

The remaining "OutputStorage" classes which used to poll for metrics and germline data
from the single sample pipelines are replaced with queues to avoid any duplication with
the persisted implementations.

DEV-1478 Run from various starting points

Adds the ability to specify a starting point to the pipeline. The starting point can be
either alignment, calling or purple complete. Each starting point builds off the last,
so purple complete is the union of all 3.

For each stage which can use persistent data, there is a PersistedXxx implementation.
These classes contain the knowledge of the location of the output files for outputs
created with this same version of the pipeline.

It works by using the exists "skipping" mechanism, but enriching the skipped output
with the actual location in google storage.

The remaining "OutputStorage" classes which used to poll for metrics and germline data
from the single sample pipelines are replaced with queues to avoid any duplication with
the persisted implementations.

DEV-1478 Added persisted output to the stage interface

This allows us to keep all the output definitions together, and remove
the decorators keeping everything a bit simpler. Still minimal changes
to the stage runner and no changes to existing stages.

Merge pull request #193 from hartwigmedical/DEV-1478-nodecorator

DEV-1478 Added persisted output to the stage interface

DEV-1478 Add tests for refactored stage interface

Add a new abstract test template to test for the persisted stages and remove
the old decorator tests.
